    Kenya backs regional law to eliminate FGM in East Africa

    By Zawadi Intel Staff | October 26, 2025

    Proposed EAC bill seeks to harmonize penalties and enforcement against cross-border FGM practices. Kenya has taken a leading role in advocating for a unified approach to eradicate female genital mutilation across East African countries.

    The East African Community is pushing for standardized laws to address the harmful tradition that affects millions of girls and women. This initiative aims to strengthen legal frameworks and improve cross-border cooperation.

    Experts highlight the importance of community education and support for survivors in the fight against FGM. The regional law could set a precedent for other African blocs to follow.

    Governments are committing resources to awareness campaigns and healthcare services to prevent the practice. International organizations are providing technical assistance to ensure effective implementation.

    As the bill progresses, it represents a significant step towards gender equality and women's rights in East Africa, potentially saving future generations from this harmful practice.
